name: market for wood wool | wood wool | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23528/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset represents the European market wood wool. Wood wool is mainly used as packing material and as raw material for wood wool boards. ;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;The product 'wood wool' represents wood shavings which are 0.03 to 0.5 mm thick and usually 2 mm wide. Wood wool has a water content (water in wet mass [kg] / dry mass [kg]) of 0.2. Wood wool is produced mainly from spruce by machines similar to planing machines. The input wood has to be dry (u<20-30%) and its length usually is around 50 cm. Wood wool is mainly used as packing material and as raw material for wood wool boards. 

Activity starts with the product leaving the factory gate, ready for shipment.

Activity ends with the reception of the product at the consuming entity. Average transportation requirements from producer to consuming entity are covered.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/161:Sawmilling and planing of wood/1610:Sawmilling and planing of wood
